Frequently Asked Questions

What is JSON validation?

JSON validation is the process of checking whether a JSON document follows the correct syntax rules and optionally conforms to a specified schema structure.

How do I fix common JSON syntax errors?

Common JSON syntax errors include missing quotes around property names, trailing commas, and unmatched brackets. Our validator helps identify these issues with precise error messages.

Can I validate against a JSON Schema?

Yes, you can paste your JSON Schema in the schema editor to validate your JSON data against it. You can also generate a schema automatically from your JSON data.
